intro: Crotalaria sturtii, commonly known as Sturt's legume, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes that form symbiotic relationships with nitrogen-fixing bacteria. Crotalaria sturtii typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its seeds are often dispersed by animals, contributing to its ecological role in native habitats.
